Analysis¶

class MolearnAnalysis[source]¶
generate(crd)[source]¶

generate a collection of protein conformations, given coordinates in the latent space :param crd: coordinates in the latent space, as a (Nx2) array :returns: collection of protein conformations in the Cartesian space (NxMx3, where M is the number of atoms in the protein)

get_all_dope_score(tensor, refine=True)[source]¶

applies _dope_score to an array of data

get_all_ramachandran_score(tensor, processes=- 1)[source]¶

applies _ramachandran_score to an array of data

get_dataset(key)[source]¶
Parameters:

key – key pointing to a dataset previously loaded with MolearnAnalysis.set_dataset(key, structure)

get_decoded(key)[source]¶
Parameters:

key – key pointing to a dataset previously loaded with MolearnAnalysis.set_dataset(key, structure)

get_dope(key, refined=True)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • key – key pointing to a dataset previously loaded with MolearnAnalysis.set_dataset(key, structure)

  • refined – if True (default), return DOPE score of input and output structure both before and after refinement

get_encoded(key)[source]¶
Parameters:

key – key pointing to a dataset previously loaded with MolearnAnalysis.set_dataset(key, structure)

Returns:

array containing the encoding in latent space of dataset associated with key

get_error(key, align=False)[source]¶

Calculate the reconstruction error of a dataset encoded and decoded by a trained neural network :param key: key pointing to a dataset previously loaded with MolearnAnalysis.set_dataset(key, structure) :param align: if True, the RMSD will be calculated by finding the optimal alignment between structures (default False) :returns: 1D array containing the RMSD between input structures and their encoded-decoded counterparts

get_ramachandran(key)[source]¶
Parameters:

key – key pointing to a dataset previously loaded with MolearnAnalysis.set_dataset(key, structure)

reference_dope_score(frame)[source]¶
Parameters:

frame – numpy array with shape [1, N, 3] with Cartesian coordinates of atoms

Returns:

DOPE score

scan_custom(fct, params, key)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • f – function taking atomic coordinates as input, an optional list of parameters. Returns a single value.

  • params – parameters to be passed to function f

  • label – name of the dataset generated by this function scan

  • samples – sampling of grid sampling

Returns:

grid scanning of latent space according to provided function, x, and y grid axes

scan_error()[source]¶

grid sample the latent space on a samples x samples grid (64 x 64 by default). Boundaries are defined by training set projections extrema, plus/minus 10%

scan_error_from_target(key, index=None)[source]¶

experimental function, creating a coloured landscape of RMSD vs single target structure target should be a Tensor of a single protein stucture loaded via load_test :param key: key pointing to a dataset previously loaded with MolearnAnalysis.set_dataset(key, structure) :param index: Default None, if key corresponds to multiple structures then an index is required to use only one structure as target.

set_dataset(key, data, atomselect='*')[source]¶
Parameters:

  • data – PDBdata object, containing atomic coordinates

  • key – string, label to be associated with data

set_decoded(key, structures)[source]¶
Parameters:

key – key pointing to a dataset previously loaded with MolearnAnalysis.set_dataset(key, structure)

set_encoded(key, coords)[source]¶
Parameters:

key – key pointing to a dataset previously loaded with MolearnAnalysis.set_dataset(key, structure)

setup_grid(samples=64, bounds_from=None, bounds=None, padding=0.1)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • samples – grid size (build a samples x samples grid)

  • bounds_from – str, list of strings, or ‘all’

  • bounds – tuple (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) or None

  • padding – define size of extra spacing around boundary conditions (as ratio of axis dimensions, default 0.1)

class MolearnGUI(MA=[])[source]¶

control colouring style of latent space surface

drop_path_event(change)[source]¶

control way paths are looked for

interact_3D(mybox, samplebox, path)[source]¶

generate and display proteins according to latent space trail

on_click(trace, points, selector)[source]¶

control display of training set

range_slider_event(change)[source]¶

update surface colouring upon manipulation of range slider

trail_update_event(change)[source]¶
